page.title: 17The Forest
page.content: Bransgore is situated very close to the west of the New Forest and this plays an important part in the life of the village. The forest is a classic example of multi land use and provides both enjoyment and livelihood for many people. Important uses of the forest are the grazing of animals, equestrian pastimes and the use of the timber resource. Ponies and cattle, although wild, all have an owner and carry the owners brand, a foal is in the same ownership as its mare. Due to the fencing off of areas of forest the number of animals has had to be reduced. The Court of Verderers and the Forestry Commission led by the Deputy Surveyor have been given wide powers to enable them to protect the New Forest from encroachment and despoliation.
